citeinfo.origin: Copernicus: The European Earth Observation Programme
citeinfo.title: Global and Regional Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (FAPAR) from SPOT-VGT and PROBA-V, 1999-present

descript.abstract: The FAPAR quantifies the fraction of the solar radiation absorbed by live leaves for the photosynthesis activity. Then, it refers only to the green and alive elements of the canopy. The FAPAR value results directly from the radiative transfer model in the canopy which is computed instantaneously. It depends on the canopy structure, vegetation element optical properties, atmospheric conditions, and angular configuration. To overcome this latter dependency, a daily integrated FAPAR value is assessed. FAPAR is very useful as input to a number of primary productivity models which run at the daily time step. The FAPAR products are derived from SPOT-VGT and PROBA-V sensors.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Global Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation from SPOT-VGT, 1999-2014
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Global FAPAR, 10x10 degree tiles and continental tiles at 1 km resolution from 19990101 through 20140531 from SPOT-VGT. Archive only. Register with geoland2 to use this service.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Global Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation from SPOT-VGT and PROBA-V, 1999-present
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Global FAPAR, 10x10 degree tiles and continental tiles at 1 km resolution from 19990101 to present from SPOT-VGT and PROBA-V. Data are available within 3 days after end of synthesis period. Register with geoland2 to use this service.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation for Africa from PROBA-V, 2014-present
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Daily integrated FAPAR values for Africa, 1 km resolution, from 20140116 to present from the PROBA-V sensor. Data are available within 3 days after end of synthesis period. Register with EUMETCast to use this service.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation for Europe from PROBA-V, 2014-present
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: FAPAR values for Europe 10x10 degree tiles, continental tiles, 1/3 km resolution from 20140501 to present from PROBA-V. Data are available within 3 days after end of synthesis period.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation for South America from PROBA-V, 2014-present
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: Daily integrated FAPAR values continental tiles, 1 km resolution, from 20140116 to present from the PROBA-V sensor. Data are available within 3 days after end of synthesis period. Register with EUMETCast to use this service.
